issue.title: Jumps over section on scroll on Safari
issue.body:
Hi!
I have an issue when scrolling a fullpage.js page it jumps over sections on macOS Monterey, Safari 15.5 5 and sometimes in Сhrome
I didn't notice this bug on demo v3.
hoped that this would be fixed in 4.0.15, but this didn't happen
https://fintechhub.sysops.xyz/

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36155714/203523659-28e5d076-8453-4eee-a030-a3c0aedd0cfc.mp4

comment.body:
I was able to reproduce the issue.
It seems to be related to the focus of the scrollable sections to enable keyboard scrolling:

https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/blob/master/src/js/scrolloverflow.js#L70

Apparently, Safari does some weird stuff on focus.
I'll re-open the issue to see if we can fix this at some point. (I've tried today for a few hours but didn't come up with a good solution)

issue.title: Conflict with Webflow Editor
issue.body:
When using the fullpage.js script, there is a conflict with the Webflow Editor which results in being unable to scroll. This has been discussed before in the Webflow forums: https://discourse.webflow.com/t/fullpage-js-and-the-cms-editor-incompatibility/30270
But I havent been able to come to a solution.

### Link to isolated reproduction with no external CSS / JS
I cannot reproduce this issue in either jsfiddle or codepen, but I can provide a read only link of the Webflow project. 
Otherwise clone the example project: https://webflow.com/made-in-webflow/website/Fullpagejs-basic-example?ref=showcase-search&searchValue=fullpage

### Steps to reproduce it
1. Using fullpage.js on a Webflow website
2. Try to edit the website in the Webflow Editor (CMS ui)
3. Not being able to scroll or use the Editor interface

### Versions 
macOS 13.0.1 (22A400)
Safari Version 16.1 (18614.2.9.1.12)
Chrome Version 107.0.5304.110 (Official Build) (arm64)

comment.body:
This is not really a fullPage.js issue but one regarding Webflow integration.

I guess you have to find a way to detect when you are inside the editor and when not.
I don't know if Webflow provides any straight way of doing this directly from JavaScript, but one idea that comes to my mind is manually detecting if you are inside the editor or not by checking if this toolbar is visible:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1706326/205345277-da16b489-b8da-47db-8535-7b32201b5754.png)


Then only initializing fullPage.js when it's not visible.

Would that fix the issue?

issue.title: Changes on ScrollOverflow content trigger scroll page
issue.body:
As discussed [here](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/react-fullpage/issues/360#issuecomment-1309932273) when modifying the content of a section containing scrollable content, it triggers a page scroll **sometimes**.

I was able to reproduce the issue in both Safari & Chrome:
https://codepen.io/alvarotrigo/pen/qqabrp

Steps to reproduce:

- Scroll to section 2
- Click button
- Scroll down a bit inside the 2nd section 
- Click button again

fullPage.js will then scroll up one section.

comment.body:
Apparently, this still happens on Safari under specific scenarios. 
We still need to find a way to reproduce the issue in an isolated codepen.

issue.title: Rename image filename from post view
issue.body:
## What problem does this address?

Currently, there's no way to rename an image uploaded directly from the post view, which is very common when copying/pasting images and texts.

We can edit the alt text, the title, etc, but not the filename, which is also an important SEO factor.

## What is your proposed solution?

There should be a quick way to edit the image filename without having to move to the media page and without having to install external plugins.

issue.title: scrollOverflow v4 autoScrolling is not smooth
issue.body:
### Description

I'm testing the scrollOverflow behavior. up to v3, I can move smoothly to the next section as shown in the Example, but in v4, it stops at the bottom of the section and does not move to the next section unless I scroll again.

In v4, it seems that importing the vendor file is no longer required, as shown below.

> 6. The option scrollOverflowOptions has been removed
> Because fullPage.js won't use the external vendor anymore, this option was also removed.

Or is there some other option that needs to be set?

[Example]

comment.body:
This is actually [a bug fix](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/issues/941) in itself, not a bug :) 

This behavior fixes very annoying issues with kinetic scrolling devices such as trackpads and some mouses like the Apple magic mouse or Logitech MX Master 3.

It is preventing unwanted scrolls on very sensitive devices, which results in having to scroll twice once reached the bottom. Which I believe is not a huge deal.

issue.title: Safari applies wrong offset on scroll to anchor & scroll
issue.body:
When reloading the page using an anchor on the URL, Safari will scroll to the right section and just when landing, it will unfocus the current section and display a white screen. (without affecting the translate3d values)

This also happens sometimes when scrolling using kinetic scrolling devices.

Apparently fullPage.js `focus` on the `scrollOverflow` wrapper is the main cause of the issue.

It can be reproduced in any basic fullpage.js setup.


```js
    new fullpage('#myContainer', {
        sectionsColor: ['#967bdc', '#4BBFC3', '#7BAABE', 'red', 'yellow', '#ccc'],
        anchors: ['firstPage', 'secondPage', '3rdPage', '4thpage'],
    });
```

Video:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1706326/201788895-ec94e534-2796-4a6a-8f5b-1166a2ff6b79.mp4

issue.title: scrollBar: true  causes touch events issues
issue.body:
When using  `scrollBar: true` there are issues when swiping on touch devices.
Scroll starts as being the normal scroll and only turns into autoScrolling after releasing the finger from the screen once.

The issue can also be reproduced on non-scrollable content to see the issue taking place. Make sure to swipe from the `fp-overflow` element.

```js
    new fullpage('#fullpage', {
        scrollBar: true,
        sectionsColor: ['red', 'orange', '#C0C0C0', '#ADD8E6'],
        anchors: ['page1', 'page2', 'page3', 'page4'],
        scrollOverflow: false,
    });
```

comment.body:
> When I'm in the part of the page with natural scroll and I want to go back to the first screen, I have to scroll more than once. I would like to be able to go back to the first screen with just one scroll.

I don't understand what's the issue.
If you are on a scrollable section, you'll first have to reach the very top of that scrollable section so you can keep on scrolling up. That's expected.

Can you elaborate and provide a jsfiddle or codepen with an isolated reproduction of the issue?

If you are talking about having to scroll more than once when reaching the top of the scrollable section, that's totally normal. 
That's to avoid unwanted scrolls on kinetic scrolling devices like many laptops trackpads, Macbooks, or mouses like Apple magic mouse or Logitech MX 3 and similars. 

Believe me, you don't want to turn that off :) 
It's actually a feature introduced in v4 to solve complains from developers using kinetic scrolling devices.

I ran into a problem when autoscrolling to another section occurs without completing the scroll of the previous one where the content exceeds the height of the section. issue.title: Scroll not full height content
issue.body:
I ran into a problem when autoscrolling to another section occurs without completing the scroll of the previous one where the content exceeds the height of the section. You can see the example I copied from https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/extensions/scrolloverflow-reset.html and just added more text https://codepen.io/rollengor/pen/WNyOZJd

Как можно это исправить?

comment.body:
A few things are wrong with that codepen:

- The scrollOverflowReset file is a [paid extension](http://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/extensions/). The file you are using is the limited version for the demo page and won't work in other websites. You need to replace it for the one you get on the purchase.
- fullPage.js 3 is being loaded instead of version 4 (use a CDN like [this](https://unpkg.com/fullpage.js@4.0.14/dist/fullpage.min.js) instead for both CSS and JS) 

Fix those and if you still having issues after purchasing the extension, use the [contact form](https://alvarotrigo.com/contact/) to get support.

issue.title: Back button in Chrome Web Browser - goes to the correct section only in Firefox & Safari
issue.body:
### Description
Hi there; on my website, I use fullPage.js only for the homepage. From sections goes links to different pages of the website. When I click back via the browser button, I should be back on the section when I click from. 

It works, but only in **Firefox & Safari.** In **Chrome or Edge** it does not work, and when I use the back button in the browser, I go to the first section every time.

Is this something that can be fixed in fullPage.js, or is this strict browser behavior?

I would like to reproduce it in jsfiddle etc., but I don't know how can I replicate there back button in browser... 😞 

### Versions 
All browsers are the last version.
fullPage.js - 4.0.12

comment.body:
Right!
That's a totally different thing yeah, and totally expected too. 
We don't have control over that either in any case.

Try using the `anchors` option instead.
That's the only way fullPage.js can know where you were on the page.

It works, but only in **Firefox & Safari.** In **Chrome or Edge** it does not work, and when I use the back button in the browser, I go to the first section every time.

Is this something that can be fixed in fullPage.js, or is this strict browser behavior?

I would like to reproduce it in jsfiddle etc., but I don't know how can I replicate there back button in browser... 😞 

### Versions 
All browsers are the last version.
fullPage.js - 4.0.12

comment.body:
> From the links you shared - it seems that this feature was in Chrome several years ago so it's not something what stopped working recently...

I'm not sure when it was merged in Chrome, but never noticed it myself and we had no other complaints either.

> By the way, in the Edge browser is the situation same.

Sounds like the exact same issue.
Clicking on the page will fix the issue.

issue.title: Back button in browser - goes to the correct section only in Firefox & Safari
issue.body:
### Description
Hi there; on my website, I use fullPage.js only for the homepage. From sections goes links to different pages of the website. When I click back via the browser button, I should be back on the section when I click from. 

It works, but only in **Firefox & Safari.** In **Chrome or Edge** it does not work, and when I use the back button in the browser, I go to the first section every time.

Is this something that can be fixed in fullPage.js, or is this strict browser behavior?

I would like to reproduce it in jsfiddle etc., but I don't know how can I replicate there back button in browser... 😞 

### Versions 
All browsers are the last version.
fullPage.js - 4.0.12

comment.body:
Alright, according to Chrome, the user must interact with the website for the URL hash change to be considered an entry on the browser history.

[Here's the merged feature](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1344199).

And [here's a related issue](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/58128939/changing-window-location-hash-creates-entry-in-history-but-doesnt-affect-chrome).

So... it looks bad :) 
We probably won't be able to overcome this.

issue.title: Conflict with Webflow Editor
issue.body:
When using the fullpage.js script, there is a conflict with the Webflow Editor which results in being unable to scroll. This has been discussed before in the Webflow forums: https://discourse.webflow.com/t/fullpage-js-and-the-cms-editor-incompatibility/30270
But I havent been able to come to a solution.

### Link to isolated reproduction with no external CSS / JS
I cannot reproduce this issue in either jsfiddle or codepen, but I can provide a read only link of the Webflow project. 
Otherwise clone the example project: https://webflow.com/made-in-webflow/website/Fullpagejs-basic-example?ref=showcase-search&searchValue=fullpage

### Steps to reproduce it
1. Using fullpage.js on a Webflow website
2. Try to edit the website in the Webflow Editor (CMS ui)
3. Not being able to scroll or use the Editor interface

### Versions 
macOS 13.0.1 (22A400)
Safari Version 16.1 (18614.2.9.1.12)
Chrome Version 107.0.5304.110 (Official Build) (arm64)

issue.title: Rename image filename from post view
issue.body:
## What problem does this address?

Currently, there's no way to rename an image uploaded directly from the post view, which is very common when copying/pasting images and texts.

We can edit the alt text, the title, etc, but not the filename, which is also an important SEO factor.

## What is your proposed solution?

There should be a quick way to edit the image filename without having to move to the media page and without having to install external plugins.

comment.body:
This is actually [a bug fix](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/issues/941) in itself, not a bug :) 

This behavior fixes very annoying issues with kinetic scrolling devices such as trackpads and some mouses like the Apple magic mouse or Logitech MX Master 3.

It is preventing unwanted scrolls on very sensitive devices, which results in having to scroll twice once reached the bottom. Which I believe is not a huge deal.

issue.title: Safari applies wrong offset on scroll to anchor & scroll
issue.body:
When reloading the page using an anchor on the URL, Safari will scroll to the right section and just when landing, it will unfocus the current section and display a white screen. (without affecting the translate3d values)

This also happens sometimes when scrolling using kinetic scrolling devices.

Apparently fullPage.js `focus` on the `scrollOverflow` wrapper is the main cause of the issue.

It can be reproduced in any basic fullpage.js setup.


```js
    new fullpage('#myContainer', {
        sectionsColor: ['#967bdc', '#4BBFC3', '#7BAABE', 'red', 'yellow', '#ccc'],
        anchors: ['firstPage', 'secondPage', '3rdPage', '4thpage'],
    });
```

Video:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1706326/201788895-ec94e534-2796-4a6a-8f5b-1166a2ff6b79.mp4

issue.title: scrollBar: true  causes touch events issues
issue.body:
When using  `scrollBar: true` there are issues when swiping on touch devices.
Scroll starts as being the normal scroll and only turns into autoScrolling after releasing the finger from the screen once.

The issue can also be reproduced on non-scrollable content to see the issue taking place. Make sure to swipe from the `fp-overflow` element.

```js
    new fullpage('#fullpage', {
        scrollBar: true,
        sectionsColor: ['red', 'orange', '#C0C0C0', '#ADD8E6'],
        anchors: ['page1', 'page2', 'page3', 'page4'],
        scrollOverflow: false,
    });
```

comment.body:
> When I'm in the part of the page with natural scroll and I want to go back to the first screen, I have to scroll more than once. I would like to be able to go back to the first screen with just one scroll.

I don't understand what's the issue.
If you are on a scrollable section, you'll first have to reach the very top of that scrollable section so you can keep on scrolling up. That's expected.

Can you elaborate and provide a jsfiddle or codepen with an isolated reproduction of the issue?

If you are talking about having to scroll more than once when reaching the top of the scrollable section, that's totally normal. 
That's to avoid unwanted scrolls on kinetic scrolling devices like many laptops trackpads, Macbooks, or mouses like Apple magic mouse or Logitech MX 3 and similars. 

Believe me, you don't want to turn that off :) 
It's actually a feature introduced in v4 to solve complains from developers using kinetic scrolling devices.

issue.title: Scroll not full height content
issue.body:
I ran into a problem when autoscrolling to another section occurs without completing the scroll of the previous one where the content exceeds the height of the section. You can see the example I copied from https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/extensions/scrolloverflow-reset.html and just added more text https://codepen.io/rollengor/pen/WNyOZJd

Как можно это исправить?

issue.title: Scroll not full height content
issue.body:
I ran into a problem when autoscrolling to another section occurs without completing the scroll of the previous one where the content exceeds the height of the section. You can see the example I copied from https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/extensions/scrolloverflow-reset.html and just added more text https://codepen.io/rollengor/pen/WNyOZJd

Как можно это исправить?

comment.body:
A few things are wrong with that codepen:

- The scrollOverflowReset file is a [paid extension](http://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/extensions/). The file you are using is the limited version for the demo page and won't work in other websites. You need to replace it for the one you get on the purchase.
- fullPage.js 3 is being loaded instead of version 4 (use a CDN like [this](https://unpkg.com/fullpage.js@4.0.14/dist/fullpage.min.js) instead for both CSS and JS) 

Fix those and if you still having issues after purchasing the extension, use the [contact form](https://alvarotrigo.com/contact/) to get support.

issue.title: Back button in Chrome Web Browser - goes to the correct section only in Firefox & Safari
issue.body:
### Description
Hi there; on my website, I use fullPage.js only for the homepage. From sections goes links to different pages of the website. When I click back via the browser button, I should be back on the section when I click from. 

It works, but only in **Firefox & Safari.** In **Chrome or Edge** it does not work, and when I use the back button in the browser, I go to the first section every time.

Is this something that can be fixed in fullPage.js, or is this strict browser behavior?

I would like to reproduce it in jsfiddle etc., but I don't know how can I replicate there back button in browser... 😞 

### Versions 
All browsers are the last version.
fullPage.js - 4.0.12

comment.body:
Right!
That's a totally different thing yeah, and totally expected too. 
We don't have control over that either in any case.

Try using the `anchors` option instead.
That's the only way fullPage.js can know where you were on the page.

issue.title: Back button in Chrome Web Browser - goes to the correct section only in Firefox & Safari
issue.body:
### Description
Hi there; on my website, I use fullPage.js only for the homepage. From sections goes links to different pages of the website. When I click back via the browser button, I should be back on the section when I click from. 

It works, but only in **Firefox & Safari.** In **Chrome or Edge** it does not work, and when I use the back button in the browser, I go to the first section every time.

Is this something that can be fixed in fullPage.js, or is this strict browser behavior?

I would like to reproduce it in jsfiddle etc., but I don't know how can I replicate there back button in browser... 😞 

### Versions 
All browsers are the last version.
fullPage.js - 4.0.12

issue.title: Back button in browser - goes to the correct section only in Firefox & Safari
issue.body:
### Description
Hi there; on my website, I use fullPage.js only for the homepage. From sections goes links to different pages of the website. When I click back via the browser button, I should be back on the section when I click from. 

It works, but only in **Firefox & Safari.** In **Chrome or Edge** it does not work, and when I use the back button in the browser, I go to the first section every time.

Is this something that can be fixed in fullPage.js, or is this strict browser behavior?

I would like to reproduce it in jsfiddle etc., but I don't know how can I replicate there back button in browser... 😞 

### Versions 
All browsers are the last version.
fullPage.js - 4.0.12

comment.body:
Alright, according to Chrome, the user must interact with the website for the URL hash change to be considered an entry on the browser history.

[Here's the merged feature](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1344199).

And [here's a related issue](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/58128939/changing-window-location-hash-creates-entry-in-history-but-doesnt-affect-chrome).

So... it looks bad :) 
We probably won't be able to overcome this.

issue.title: Conflict with Webflow Editor
issue.body:
When using the fullpage.js script, there is a conflict with the Webflow Editor which results in being unable to scroll. This has been discussed before in the Webflow forums: https://discourse.webflow.com/t/fullpage-js-and-the-cms-editor-incompatibility/30270
But I havent been able to come to a solution.

### Link to isolated reproduction with no external CSS / JS
I cannot reproduce this issue in either jsfiddle or codepen, but I can provide a read only link of the Webflow project. 
Otherwise clone the example project: https://webflow.com/made-in-webflow/website/Fullpagejs-basic-example?ref=showcase-search&searchValue=fullpage

### Steps to reproduce it
1. Using fullpage.js on a Webflow website
2. Try to edit the website in the Webflow Editor (CMS ui)
3. Not being able to scroll or use the Editor interface

### Versions 
macOS 13.0.1 (22A400)
Safari Version 16.1 (18614.2.9.1.12)
Chrome Version 107.0.5304.110 (Official Build) (arm64)

issue.title: Rename image filename from post view
issue.body:
## What problem does this address?

Currently, there's no way to rename an image uploaded directly from the post view, which is very common when copying/pasting images and texts.

We can edit the alt text, the title, etc, but not the filename, which is also an important SEO factor.

## What is your proposed solution?

There should be a quick way to edit the image filename without having to move to the media page and without having to install external plugins.

comment.body:
This is actually [a bug fix](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/issues/941) in itself, not a bug :) 

This behavior fixes very annoying issues with kinetic scrolling devices such as trackpads and some mouses like the Apple magic mouse or Logitech MX Master 3.

It is preventing unwanted scrolls on very sensitive devices, which results in having to scroll twice once reached the bottom. Which I believe is not a huge deal.

issue.title: Safari applies wrong offset on scroll to anchor & scroll
issue.body:
When reloading the page using an anchor on the URL, Safari will scroll to the right section and just when landing, it will unfocus the current section and display a white screen. (without affecting the translate3d values)

This also happens sometimes when scrolling using kinetic scrolling devices.

Apparently fullPage.js `focus` on the `scrollOverflow` wrapper is the main cause of the issue.

It can be reproduced in any basic fullpage.js setup.


```js
    new fullpage('#myContainer', {
        sectionsColor: ['#967bdc', '#4BBFC3', '#7BAABE', 'red', 'yellow', '#ccc'],
        anchors: ['firstPage', 'secondPage', '3rdPage', '4thpage'],
    });
```

Video:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1706326/201788895-ec94e534-2796-4a6a-8f5b-1166a2ff6b79.mp4

issue.title: scrollBar: true  causes touch events issues
issue.body:
When using  `scrollBar: true` there are issues when swiping on touch devices.
Scroll starts as being the normal scroll and only turns into autoScrolling after releasing the finger from the screen once.

The issue can also be reproduced on non-scrollable content to see the issue taking place. Make sure to swipe from the `fp-overflow` element.

```js
    new fullpage('#fullpage', {
        scrollBar: true,
        sectionsColor: ['red', 'orange', '#C0C0C0', '#ADD8E6'],
        anchors: ['page1', 'page2', 'page3', 'page4'],
        scrollOverflow: false,
    });
```

comment.body:
> When I'm in the part of the page with natural scroll and I want to go back to the first screen, I have to scroll more than once. I would like to be able to go back to the first screen with just one scroll.

I don't understand what's the issue.
If you are on a scrollable section, you'll first have to reach the very top of that scrollable section so you can keep on scrolling up. That's expected.

Can you elaborate and provide a jsfiddle or codepen with an isolated reproduction of the issue?

If you are talking about having to scroll more than once when reaching the top of the scrollable section, that's totally normal. 
That's to avoid unwanted scrolls on kinetic scrolling devices like many laptops trackpads, Macbooks, or mouses like Apple magic mouse or Logitech MX 3 and similars. 

Believe me, you don't want to turn that off :) 
It's actually a feature introduced in v4 to solve complains from developers using kinetic scrolling devices.

issue.body:
I ran into a problem when autoscrolling to another section occurs without completing the scroll of the previous one where the content exceeds the height of the section. You can see the example I copied from https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/extensions/scrolloverflow-reset.html and just added more text https://codepen.io/rollengor/pen/WNyOZJd

Как можно это исправить?

comment.body:
A few things are wrong with that codepen:

- The scrollOverflowReset file is a [paid extension](http://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/extensions/). The file you are using is the limited version for the demo page and won't work in other websites. You need to replace it for the one you get on the purchase.
- fullPage.js 3 is being loaded instead of version 4 (use a CDN like [this](https://unpkg.com/fullpage.js@4.0.14/dist/fullpage.min.js) instead for both CSS and JS) 

Fix those and if you still having issues after purchasing the extension, use the [contact form](https://alvarotrigo.com/contact/) to get support.

issue.title: Back button in Chrome Web Browser - goes to the correct section only in Firefox & Safari
issue.body:
### Description
Hi there; on my website, I use fullPage.js only for the homepage. From sections goes links to different pages of the website. When I click back via the browser button, I should be back on the section when I click from. 

It works, but only in **Firefox & Safari.** In **Chrome or Edge** it does not work, and when I use the back button in the browser, I go to the first section every time.

Is this something that can be fixed in fullPage.js, or is this strict browser behavior?

I would like to reproduce it in jsfiddle etc., but I don't know how can I replicate there back button in browser... 😞 

### Versions 
All browsers are the last version.
fullPage.js - 4.0.12

comment.body:
Right!
That's a totally different thing yeah, and totally expected too. 
We don't have control over that either in any case.

Try using the `anchors` option instead.
That's the only way fullPage.js can know where you were on the page.

issue.title: Back button in browser - goes to the correct section only in Firefox & Safari
issue.body:
### Description
Hi there; on my website, I use fullPage.js only for the homepage. From sections goes links to different pages of the website. When I click back via the browser button, I should be back on the section when I click from. 

It works, but only in **Firefox & Safari.** In **Chrome or Edge** it does not work, and when I use the back button in the browser, I go to the first section every time.

Is this something that can be fixed in fullPage.js, or is this strict browser behavior?

I would like to reproduce it in jsfiddle etc., but I don't know how can I replicate there back button in browser... 😞 

### Versions 
All browsers are the last version.
fullPage.js - 4.0.12

comment.body:
Alright, according to Chrome, the user must interact with the website for the URL hash change to be considered an entry on the browser history.

[Here's the merged feature](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1344199).

And [here's a related issue](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/58128939/changing-window-location-hash-creates-entry-in-history-but-doesnt-affect-chrome).

So... it looks bad :) 
We probably won't be able to overcome this.
